1.description: First, add the switch, positioning it prominently on the front face of the object to ensure easy access for the user. This switch serves a crucial function by allowing the user to control the power and operation of the device, establishing the foundation for subsequent components that will rely on its functionality.

2.description: Next, add the vertical support directly beneath the switch to provide a stable foundation and ensure that the switch is securely mounted in place. This support not only reinforces the structural integrity of the assembly but also facilitates the transfer of forces during operation, preventing any wobbling or misalignment of the switch.

3.description: Then, add the tube horizontally connecting the vertical support to create a sturdy framework for the object; this tube will serve as a conduit for wiring or other components, enhancing the overall functionality. Position the tube so that it is securely attached to the vertical support, ensuring stability and allowing for seamless integration with the switch already in place.

4.description: Then, add the head to the top of the vertical support, ensuring it securely fits over the tube, which serves as a central connector. This head is crucial as it houses the essential components that will interact with the switch, effectively transforming the vertical support into a functional unit that can activate or control the intended mechanism.

5.description: Finally, add the mouth at the front of the head to serve as the primary opening for interaction, allowing the object to perform its intended function effectively. This mouth connects directly beneath the head and integrates seamlessly with the tube, ensuring that all components work together harmoniously to create a cohesive and functional design.
